<h1 style="text-align:left; color:#003f63;">About Me</h1>


<!-- Professional Summary -->
<div style="text-align:left; max-width:900px; margin:auto;">
<p style="font-size:18px; line-height:1.7; color:#333;">
 <strong>Sundarabalan .V. Balasubramanian</strong> is a Postdoctoral Fellow in the <strong>Department of Biology</strong> at the <strong>University of Massachusetts Boston</strong>, USA.  
He specializes in <strong>ocean color remote sensing, aquatic optics, hyperspectral imaging,</strong> and the use of <strong>machine learning</strong> for aquatic environmental monitoring.
</p>
    
<p style="font-size:18px; line-height:1.7; color:#333; margin-top:20px;">
Sundarabalan has over a decade of research experience in <strong>satellite remote sensing, optical modeling, and data-driven environmental analysis</strong>.He has worked at leading institutions including <strong>NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC)</strong>, <strong>GESTAR-II/UMBC</strong>, and <strong>IIT Madras</strong>.His work bridges <strong>field observations</strong>, <strong>satellite product validation</strong>, and <strong>AI-based modeling frameworks</strong> for complex aquatic systems.
</p>

<!-- Research Interests -->
<h2 style="color:#003f63; margin-top:30px;">Research Interests</h2>
<ul style="font-size:16px; line-height:1.7; color:#003f63;">
  <li><strong>Ocean Satellite Remote Sensing</strong> and applications for aquatic systems</li>
  <li><strong>Aquatic Optics</strong> and bio-optical modeling of natural waters</li>
  <li><strong>Water Quality Assessment</strong> using multi-sensor satellite data</li>
  <li><strong>Data Science</strong> approaches including <strong>Machine Learning (ML)</strong> and <strong>Deep Learning (DL)</strong></li>
  <li><strong>Field Measurements</strong> for optical and biogeochemical parameter validation</li>
  <li>Integration of <strong>Drone (UAV) Imagery</strong> and <strong>Underwater Imaging</strong> for coastal and inland water studies</li>
</ul>
